content: 6 5 7 from the beginning of the cuff ending on round 4 the colorwork pattern described above in rounds 1-4 is also shown in the chart below the repeating colorwork pattern described in rounds 1-4 is indicated by the red box crown shaping round 1 place marker for the beginning of the round *k7 8 9 10 11 12 13 k2 decrease and place a marker* repeat until end of round you will have decreased 10 sts round 2 k1 mc k1 cc * repeat until end of round round 3 *knit until 2 st before the marker k2tog slip marker* repeat until end of round repeat round 2 and round 3 until 20 sts remain for child and adult sizes switch to dpns when needed **note the colorwork pattern will end up being off for the crown shaping this shouldn t be noticeable and shouldn t affect the over all look of the hat © emma kerian 2017 finishing option 1 no pom pom repeat r3 and r4 until 20 sts remain break both cc and mc yarns draw mc through the remaining 20 sts tightly closing the hole at the top weave in ends and block option 2 pom pom with a safety pin follow instructions for the no pom pom option above make a 2 ½ inch size pom pom or desired size using a safety pin attach pom pom to the top of the hat with the side you want facing out remove pom pom to wash the hat reattach the pom pom using the safety pin to other side of the hat when you want to reverse it option 3 pom pom pushed through a hole on the top of the hat make a 2 ½ inch size pom pom or desired size leaving the two tails ~ 6 break both cc and mc yarns and draw mc through the remaining 20sts loosely to form a ~ 1 hole or appropriate size to fit the pom pom through tie a knot through one of the 20sts after you ve formed the appropriate size hole for your pom pom make the hole big enough so your pom pom can just fit through after making the pom pom you should have two long tails right next to each other using a tapestry needle thread one of the tails through the pom pom so that it is on the opposite side from the other 6 tail with your needle still through one of the pom pom tails attach one side of the pom pom to a side of the hole at the top of the hat and secure with a knot thread the needle through the other tail and attach the other side of the pom-pom to the opposite side of the hole and secure with a knot weave in ends and block © emma kerian 2017 *note you need to attach both sides of the pom
